alert.note: Alert for City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Poquoson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Hampton, City of Newport News and City of Poquoson. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Hampton, Hampton University, Langley AFB, Northampton, Buckroe Beach, Fort Monroe, Grand View, Langley View, Raleigh Terrace, Phoebus, Messick, Fox Hill, Plum Tree Island Refuge and Hilton Village. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Hampton; City of Newport News; City of Poquoson
